Job Title: Senior Technical Project Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description

The Opportunity: The Senior Technical Project Manager is part of Litera’s R&D Operations team and will be responsible for running mission critical cross-functional projects, including post-deal R&D integration for acquisitions, and providing overall program support for the R&D organization on highly technical projects.

A Day in the Life:

Supports the R&D team on various strategic projects, driving the planning and roll-out of projects from inception to completionDevelops full-scale project plans including communication documentsIdentifies and manages project dependencies and critical pathSet and continually manage project expectations with involved team membersWorks with leadership to create an integrated project plan and schedule to deliver projects; ensures tasks and responsibilities are clearly assignedOwns program management activities for active R&D integrations, including planning, status tracking, reporting, and meeting facilitationDrives key actions from our RCDOs (Rally Cry Defining Objectives aka OKRs), ensuring consistency and quality of data, program progress, and risksEstimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goalsCo-operates closely with cross-functional program managers, team-leaders, and R&D project teamsImplements and manages changes and interventions to achieve project goalsProvides regular reports on project progress, problems, and solutionsManages risks and issues, escalating to leadership where necessaryConstantly evaluates project’s ability to meet its objectives and modify or reschedule project plans as required with support from leadership

Role progression:

Within 1 month, you will: 

Complete onboarding processFamiliarize yourself with the business, R&D organization, and core systemsUnderstand Litera’s H1 (Half 1) R&D RCDOsPartner with R&D Operations leadership to understand key in flight and upcoming projectsLearn the integration approach and process, including the integration playbook, best practices, and key activitiesAt the rate we make acquisitions, you will also start to participate in a secondary role on an in-flight acquisition

Within 3 months, you will:

Have a good understanding of Litera standard software development process and toolsHelp drive the R&D owned RCDOs and contribute to those with R&D collaborationLead, coordinate, and facilitate special projects and key meetingsStart owning project management role for active R&D integrationsCollaborate across teams (locally and internationally)

Within 6 months, you will: 

Drive a subset of R&D owned RCDO initiatives and special projectsProject manage multiple M&A initiatives simultaneously at various stages in the R&D integration processBuild relationships with functional leads and serve as trusted project manager on key projectsUse data and metrics to identify areas improvement and drive positive changeHelp ensure compliance with standard project processes and best practicesIdentify potential integration/project pitfalls and implement mitigation plans

About You:

AccountableDrivenProactiveA servant-leaderSomeone who collaborates well with team membersGoal orientedOrganizedDetail oriented

Qualifications

8+ years project/program management experience in a technology environmentExperienced in supporting integration projectsDemonstrated experience working within Agile software development methodologies including but not limited to Scrum, Kanban, XP, SAFeExperience leading technical projects in areas like infrastructure, agile software development, and product developmentAbility to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and ambiguous environmentExperienced in collaborating with cross-functional and international teamsExcellent written/verbal communication and presentation skills targeting various stakeholders and senior managementAbility to work independently on day-to-day initiatives with appropriate support from manager and teammatesHigh attention to detail with strong facilitation and organization skillsStrong desire to keep learning new thingsYou get things done

What Sets Us Apart

Work with a team that has a proven track recordYou’ll be challenged and encouraged to broaden your skillsOpportunity to make a difference in a rapidly growing companyWork with an organization that promotes continuous improvementGreat health benefits, PTO, holiday policies, & moreCasual and flexible work environment

California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Maryland, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Maryland, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Rhode Island, or Washington residents is $100,000 to $150,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, Litera offers benefits such as a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Litera is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
